properties.name: Bijou Cinema
properties.description: Posted by System   215 Broad Street, Chattanooga, TN, 37402Bijou Cinema 423-265-5220

properties.name: Clumpies Ice Cream Company
properties.description: Posted by Beelerspace 26B Frazier Avenue, Chattanooga, TN, 37405Two brainchild of two nearby university students, Clumpie\'s has delicious, and sometimes experimental, ice cream. Clumpies Ice Cream CO 423-267-5425

properties.name: Durty Nelly's
properties.description: Posted by Beelerspace  109 N Market St, chattanoogaGreat Irish pub just off the main drag in Chattanooga. After they stopped serving French wine, our friend refused to ever go again. Well, shame on him! Their bread pudding is the best I\'ve ever had.

properties.name: Greyfriar's
properties.description: Posted by Beelerspace 406 Broad Street # B, Chattanooga, TN, 37402Delicious coffee (they roast their own!) and tea. Internet, a steady and interesting clientele, and fairly good hours. Always worth a stop when downtown. Greyfriar\'s 423-267-0376

properties.name: Hamilton Place Cinemas 10-17
properties.description: Posted by Beelerspace  2000 Hamilton Place Boulevard, Chattanooga, TN, 37421A "dollar" theater, using with movies only a few weeks old. Nice and clean too. Hamilton Place Cinemas 10-17 423-855-0064

properties.name: Hamilton Place Mall (and where I worked at EB Games)
properties.description: Posted by Beelerspace 2100 Hamilton Place Blvd, chattanoogaSupposedly the biggest mall in Tennessee. I worked at the EB Games for three years as assistant manager. If you go in, say hi to Wally for me, my boss and a great guy. Parking is a bitch during holidays.

properties.name: Hungry House
properties.description: Posted by Beelerspace 4457 Highway 58, Chattanooga, TN, 37416Well. This should be on places we once loved. A Waffle House-y place that used to be great. Until this happened. Short story: don\'t use your laptops here or they will kill you. Hungry House 423-899-4507

properties.name: Lookout Mountain Presbyterian Church
properties.description: Posted by Beelerspace316 N Bragg Ave, Lookout Mountain, TNThe church building is beautiful, and the pastor - Joe Novenson - is easily the best preacher I have ever heard (he speaks at Lee now and again - don\'t miss him). But the drive up and down the hill..er.."mountain" is hell on your transmission and brakes.

properties.name: Lupi's Pizza Pies
properties.description: Posted by Beelerspace 406 Broad Street # A, Chattanooga, TN, 37402Lupi\'s Pizza Pies 423-266-5874

properties.name: Mc Kay Used Books & CD's
properties.description: Posted by Beelerspace6435 Lee Hwy, Chattanooga, TNA huge used book warehouse. Make sure you bring some books to trade in!

properties.name: Mudpie Coffee House & Newsstand
properties.description: Posted by Beelerspace  12 Frazier Avenue, Chattanooga, TN, 37405This has passed hands a few times but always manages to stay open and maintain steady and delicious food and drink. Very busy during the summer. The back porch is the best place to be, and has an excellent view of the river and riverpark. Mudpie Coffee House & Newsstand 423-267-9043

properties.name: Our first place in Chattanooga
properties.description: Posted by Beelerspace 7255 lee highway #217, chattanoogaAn apartment complex where we lived across from a drug dealer, and underneath a couple that alternate having sex and throwing each other\'s stuff out of the window. It was awesome.

properties.name: Our second house in Chattanooga
properties.description: Posted by Beelerspace 7616 bishop drive, chattanoogaThis was tucked away at the top of a cute hill just barely inside the city. At the bottom was a railroad, and when the train went through you had to stop talking. It was great. The backyard was grassy, and then sheltered with lots of trees. We have many fond memories of sitting on the back porch during summer watching the fireflies.

properties.name: Rembrandt's Coffee House
properties.description: Posted by Beelerspace 204 High Street Frnt, Chattanooga, TN, 37403Everyone always went here, but I always thought Rembrandt\'s was overrated. If you wanted great tea and coffee, go to Grayfriar\'s. If you wanted atmosphere, go to the Mudpie. If you want pretension, go to Rembrandt\'s. Still, the area around Rembrandt\'s is really pretty. There is a great vista and a romantic little Italian-y villa fountain nearby! Rembrandt\'s Coffee House 423-265-5033

properties.name: Sticky Fingers
properties.description: Posted by System 2031 Hamilton Place Boulevard, Chattanooga, TN, 37421Sticky Fingers 423-899-7427

properties.name: Sweet Basil Thai Cuisine
properties.description: Posted by Beelerspace 5845 Brainerd Road, Chattanooga, TN, 37411Sweet Basil Thai Cuisine 423-485-8836

properties.name: The Walking Bridge
properties.description: Posted by BeelerspaceA really long and wide railroad bridge cum pedestrian bridge that does an excellent job of connecting one side of bohemian downtown with the other. When the weather warms up, the bridge becomes this center of activity with families walking across, people walking their dogs, musicians, and weirdos. Great for walking or people watching.

properties.name: Underground City of the Futuristic Apocolyptic Mutants
properties.description: Posted by BeelerspaceJust behind the walking bridge is a way to go underneath the busy road, and to the shore of the river just under the bridge. It is also where Mutants will live when the apocolypse comes. Not a place to go by yourself at night (although it is pretty!) but if you have a friend, well worth the descent.

properties.name: YUM YUM Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Beelerspace 2114 Dodds Avenue, Chattanooga, TN, 37404You never know when it\'s open, and it\'s a little scary. But the owner is really friendly, and you get _huge_ portions! YUM YUM Restaurant 423-622-2636
